description: Lesioning measured by fresh weight [23C and 8hrs daylight (Short Day) for 7 weeks]

Following inoculation of two leaves per plant with 0.1 ml of 10 -8 cfu/ml bacteria in 10 mM MgSO4 buffer using a blunt-tipped syringe. Leaf collapse was scored at 20 hrs and again at 24 hrs after inoculation [20C and 12 hrs daylight]
Results expressed as binary data - determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of anthocyanin in all 4 plants / accession after 5wks of growth [16C and 16 hrs daylight]

Sulfur concentrations in leaves grown in soil. Elemental analysis was performed with an ICP-MS (PerkinElmer). Sample normalized to calculated weights as described in Baxter et al. 2008 [20C and 16 hrs daylight]

Following inoculation of two leaves per plant with 0.1 ml of 10 -8 cfu/ml bacteria in 10 mM MgSO4 buffer using a blunt-tipped syringe. Leaf collapse was scored at 20 hrs and again at 24 hrs after inoculation [20C and 12 hrs daylight]

Following inoculation of two leaves per plant with 0.1 ml of 10 -8 cfu/ml bacteria in 10 mM MgSO4 buffer using a blunt-tipped syringe. Leaf collapse was scored at 20 hrs and again at 24 hrs after inoculation [20C and 12 hrs daylight]

Four days after inoculation leaves were scored by eye for disease symptom using a scale from 0 (no visible symptom) to 10 (leaves collapse and turn yellow) with an increment of 1. [20C and 12 hrs daylight]
Results expressed as binary data determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of rolled leaves in all 4 plants / accession at 5 weeks growth [16C and 16 hrs daylight]
Presence / absence of sporangiophores determined on 5-10 seedlings of each genotype with three independent replications [20-22C with 10 hrs daylight and 70% humidity]
Presence / absence of sporangiophores determined on 5-10 seedlings of each genotype with three independent replications [20-22C with 10 hrs daylight and 70% humidity]

Results expressed as binary data determined by the presence (1) or absence (0) of rolled leaves in all 4 plants / accession at 5 weeks growth [16C and 16 hrs daylight]

Following inoculation of two leaves per plant with 0.1 ml of 10 -8 cfu/ml bacteria in 10 mM MgSO4 buffer using a blunt-tipped syringe. Leaf collapse was scored at 20 hrs and again at 24 hrs after inoculation [20C and 12 hrs daylight]

Genotypes consistently decreased in germination rate between 91 and 133 days of dry storage. This sudden reduction was scored by the slope between germination percentages at these two time points [91-133 days dry storage]
Presence / absence of sporangiophores determined on 5-10 seedlings of each genotype with three independent replications [20-22C with 10 hrs daylight and 70% humidity]
Number of days of seed dry storage required to reach 50% germination or DSDS50 value (Alonso-Blanco et al. 2003) [Dry storage followed by 25C 12h day and 20C 12h night for 1 week]
